Title: Indonesia to suspend all foreign arrivals; barring a few exceptions
Content: Indonesia's Foreign Minister said on Tuesday the government has decided to ban all arrivals and transits by foreigners in Indonesia to prevent a further spread of the coronavirus.

Title: Air Canada to temporarily lay off half its workforce
Content: Air Canada announced Monday it would temporarily lay off nearly half of its employees and reduce activity by up to 90 per cent in the second quarter due to the coronavirus.

Title: Cabby dies after taxi catches fire along Seletar West Link
Content: SINGAPORE: A 58-year-old ComfortDelGro taxi driver has died after his vehicle caught fire early Tuesday morning (Mar 31).

Title: G20 finance ministers to hold virtual talks on coronavirus crisis
Content: Finance ministers and central bankers of the Group of 20 major economies will hold a second round of virtual talks Tuesday to push ahead the coronavirus response; the Saudi hosts said.

Title: Myanmar reports first COVID-19 death; man had 4-day layover in Singapore
Content: SINGAPORE: A Myanmar national who had a four-day layover in Singapore on his way home from Australia has died from COVID-19; Myanmar Ministry of Health and Sports spokesperson Dr Khin Khin Gyi said on Tuesday (Mar 31). The 69-year-old man; who died at about 7…

Title: COVID-19 epidemic 'far from over' in Asia: WHO official
Content: The coronavirus epidemic is "far from over" in the Asia-Pacific region; and the current measures to curb the spread of the virus are merely buying time for countries to prepare for large-scale community transmissions; a WHO official said on Tuesday.

Title: Demand explodes for New York food banks
Content: New York food banks have become inundated with newcomers deprived of income since the near-total halt of business in the United States' economic capital.

Title: Teenager stole from at least 10 taxi drivers while they were distracted; gets probation
Content: SINGAPORE: A teenager who distracted multiple taxi drivers before stealing their cash or wallets; at times looping in accomplices for his scheme; was sentenced to 21 months' probation on Monday (Mar 30). Saif Ali Khan Sadik Hussain; 18; also has to perform 11…

Title: South Korea to open schools online; reschedule college exam
Content: South Korea said on Tuesday it will open school classes online next week and reschedule its annual college entrance exams slated for November as concerns persist over the coronavirus and small outbreaks continue to emerge.

Title: Airlines must suggest possible US compensation for grants: Treasury
Content: Airlines must suggest possible compensation in return for government cash assistance and agree to conditions that include not cutting pay or laying off employees through Sept. 30; the U.S. Treasury Department said in guidelines issued on Monday as it prepares…

Title: Govt to introduce new legislation over meetings; as firms uncertain about how to comply with COVID-19 rules
Content: SINGAPORE: The Government will introduce new legislation to provide clarity over how meetings are conducted; the Ministry of Law and Ministry of Finance said in a media release on Tuesday (Mar 31).

Title: Instacart; Amazon workers strike as labour unrest grows during coronavirus crisis
Content: Warehouse; delivery and retail gig workers in the United States went on strike on Monday to call attention to safety and wage concerns for people laboring through the coronavirus crisis.

Title: Restrictions are slowing coronavirus infections in the US; new data suggests
Content: NEW YORK: Harsh measures; including stay-at-home orders and restaurant closures; are contributing to rapid drops in the numbers of fevers - a signal symptom of most coronavirus infections - recorded in states across the country; according to intriguing new da…

Title: Asia shares edge up; China factories show flicker of life
Content: SYDNEY: Asian shares managed a tentative rally on Tuesday as factory data from China held out the hope of a rebound in activity even as other countries across the globe all but shut down. China's official manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) bounced…

Title: US coronavirus death toll rises past 3;000 on deadliest day
Content: NEW YORK: The US death toll from the coronavirus pandemic climbed past 3;000 on Monday (Mar 30); the deadliest day yet in the country's mounting crisis; while New York cheered the arrival of a gleaming 1;000-bed US Navy hospital ship as a sign of hope in the …

Title: Florida megachurch pastor charged with defying COVID-19 stay-at-home orders
Content: The pastor of a megachurch in Tampa; Florida; was arrested on Monday on charges of holding prayer services in violation of public health orders temporarily banning such gatherings to limit the spread of coronavirus infections; authorities said.

Title: American Airlines seeking up to US$12 billion from aid package
Content: American Airlines intends to apply for up to US$12 billion government aid; ensuring no involuntary layoffs or pay cuts in the next six months; executives said in a memo to employees on Monday.

Title: US Air Force finds additional deficiency in Boeing's aerial fuel system
Content: The U.S. Air Force announced on Monday an additional deficiency in the KC-46 Pegasus aerial fuel system built by Boeing ; classifying it at the Category I level; meaning it is a major technical issue that may endanger the aircrew and aircraft.

Title: China's March official factory activity unexpectedly expands after steep contraction
Content: Factory activity in China unexpectedly expanded in March after contracting sharply to a record low; but the rapid global spread of the coronavirus is expected to keep businesses and the overall economy under heavy pressure as foreign demand slumps.

Title: ERP rates to be cut at 96% of gantries amid COVID-19 outbreak
Content: SINGAPORE: Electronic Road Pricing (ERP) rates will be cut at 96 per cent of gantries in Singapore; the Land Transport Authority (LTA) announced on Tuesday (Mar 31); citing “exceptional circumstances” due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

Title: Crude rises after US; Russia agree to oil market talks
Content: Oil recovered some ground on Tuesday as U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin agreed to discuss stabilizing energy markets; but prices remain near 18-year lows as the coronavirus shutdown destroys demand.

Title: China reports 48 new confirmed coronavirus cases; all imported
Content: BEIJING: Mainland China reported on Tuesday (Mar 31) a rise in new confirmed coronavirus cases; reversing four days of declines; due to an uptick in infections involving travellers arriving from overseas. Mainland China had 48 new cases on Monday; the Nationa…

Title: Asia shares make cautious gains; investors eye China PMI
Content: Asian share markets managed a tentative rally on Tuesday after European and U.S. equities stabilized; though buying for month and quarter-end book balancing likely flattered the gains.

Title: US man teaching dog how to drive arrested after high-speed chase
Content: LOS ANGELES: A resident of the western US state of Washington was arrested following a high-speed chase that left officers dumbfounded after they found the man's pit bull behind the wheel.

Title: Samsung says chip factory worker tests positive for virus; output not affected
Content: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Tuesday that one of its chip factory workers in South Korea had tested positive for coronavirus; but its output has not been affected.

Title: US senators urge delay to USMCA trade deal start date
Content: A bipartisan group of 19 U.S. senators urged the Trump administration to push back the planned June 1 start date for the new U.S.-Mexico-Canada trade pact; saying the short lead time would add to pressures on U.S. companies due to the spread of the coronaviru…

Title: US senators urge coronavirus delay to June 1 USMCA trade deal start date

Title: Brazil's Bolsonaro urges no more coronavirus quarantine; says jobs being lost
Content: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that there can be no more quarantine measures imposed on the country than those already in place to combat coronavirus because jobs are being destroyed and the poor are suffering disproportionately.

Title: New Zealand extends state of emergency to stop spread of COVID-19
Content: WELLINGTON: New Zealand is extending the state of national emergency for a further seven days to help stop the spread of COVID-19; the Minister of Civil Defence Peeni Henare said in a statement on Tuesday (Mar 31).

Title: Trump says US to send medical supplies to Italy; France; Spain
Content: President Donald Trump said Monday that the United States will send medical equipment for combating the coronavirus pandemic to Italy and later France and Spain.

Title: Activist investor Starboard says it has 9.3per cent stake in software firm Commvault
Content: Activist investor Starboard Value LP has built a stake in U.S. data protection and data management software company Commvault; saying in a regulatory filing that it felt the shares were undervalued when it purchased them.

Title: Activist investor Starboard says it has 9.3% stake in software firm Commvault
Content: Activist investor Starboard Value has built a stake in U.S. data protection and data management software company Commvault; saying in a regulatory filing that it felt the shares were undervalued when it purchased them.

Content: American Airlines Holdings Inc  intends to apply for up to US$12 billion government aid; ensuring no involuntary layoffs or pay cuts in the next six months; executives said in a memo to employees on Monday.

Title: US judge stops Texas from curbing abortions during coronavirus crisis
Content: A U.S. judge on Monday blocked Texas officials from banning most abortions in the state as part of their order to postpone surgeries and procedures deemed not medically necessary during the coronavirus crisis.

Title: Airlines line up furloughs; Air New Zealand sees smaller carrier in a year
Content: Major global airlines projected layoffs; furloughs and capacity cuts over the next few months; with Air New Zealand warning that it expected staffing levels to be 30per cent smaller than it is now; due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: In first; UN Security Council approves resolutions remotely
Content: The UN Security Council on Monday for the first time approved resolutions remotely after painstaking negotiations among diplomats who are teleworking due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: Coronavirus could force GM to delay its redesigned 2021 SUVs
Content: DETROIT: General Motors Co told suppliers on Monday (Mar 30) that it is postponing work on at least half a dozen future models to conserve cash during the coronavirus pandemic and could delay the planned launch in late April of its highly profitable large spo…

Title: Spirit cancels New York; Connecticut; New Jersey flights after CDC warning
Content: Low-cost U.S. carrier Spirit Airlines Inc said on Monday it will cancel all flights to and from New York; Connecticut and New Jersey after U.S. officials warned against travel to the area because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Japan destroyer; China fishing boat collide in sea off Shanghai

Content: American Airlines Holdings Inc  intends to apply for up to US$12 billion government aid; ensuring no involuntary layoffs or pay cuts in the next six months; executives said in a memo to employees on Monday.

Title: KFC owner Yum Brands breaks junk debt market's fast
Content: Yum Brands Inc ; owner of Pizza Hut; KFC and Taco Bell restaurant chains; sold US$600 million in bonds on Monday; reopening the U.S. market for junk-rated debt issues after its longest lull since the 2008 financial crisis.

Title: Airbnb to pay out US$250 million to hosts to help ease coronavirus cancellation pain

Content: Kroger Co; Walmart Inc; Albertsons and other grocery sellers are installing plexiglass partitions at checkout counters to protect cashiers from the highly contagious coronavirus.

Title: Credit Suisse weighs curbing bonuses at time of coronavirus: CEO
Content: Credit Suisse  bank could restrain 2020 bonuses in a show of unity with victims of the coronavirus epidemic in Switzerland; Chief Executive Thomas Gottstein said on Monday.

Title: Visa transaction volumes hurt as coronavirus crisis deepens
Content: Visa Inc  said on Monday its transaction volumes had been hit as the coronavirus pandemic wreaks havoc on consumer spending; leading it to forecast mid-single-digit percentage revenue growth for the second quarter.

Title: Macy's; Kohl's; Gap turn to mass furloughs as virus crisis deepens
Content: Macy's Inc  said on Monday it would furlough most of its employees starting this week as all stores of the department chain operator stay closed to curb the spread of the coronavirus.

Title: Dow ends up 3.2% as US stocks finish solidly higher
Content: NEW YORK: Wall Street stocks gained more than three per cent on Monday (Mar 30) as markets weighed a dire near-term economic outlook against unprecedented federal spending and central bank interventions.

Title: Trump coronavirus guidance on keeping gun stores open draws criticism
Content: WASHINGTON: Gun control activists on Monday (Mar 30) criticised guidance issued by President Donald Trump's administration recommending that states find that gun stores are critical businesses that can stay open during the coronavirus crisis.

Title: Spanish tenor Domingo leaves hospital after COVID-19 treatment

Title: Fiat Chrysler CEO to halve his salary for three months in virus response: letter
Content: Fiat Chrysler  top executives will temporarily cut their salaries to preserve the automaker's financial soundness during the coronavirus emergency; Chief Executive Mike Manley told employees on Monday.

Title: Wall Street rallies; led by healthcare jump
Content: U.S. stocks rose on Monday as President Donald Trump followed last week's massive fiscal stimulus package by extending his stay-at-home guidelines; leaving investors hopeful the economic impact of the coronavirus could still be contained.    A record US$2.2 t…

Title: New York cheers arrival of hospital ship as coronavirus cases soar
Content: NEW YORK: People cheered the US Navy hospital ship Comfort as it sailed into New York on Monday (Mar 30); a beacon of the national effort to stanch the coronavirus outbreak at its US epicentre as the number of cases soared. Painted a gleaming white and adorne…

Title: Senior Italian cardinal; papal vicar for Rome; has coronavirus
Content: ROME: Cardinal Angelo De Donatis; Pope Francis' vicar for the diocese of Rome; on Monday (Mar 30) became the highest-ranking Catholic official known to test positive for coronavirus.

Title: Italy sees 812 more coronavirus deaths; but new cases fall steeply
Content: ROME: The death toll from an outbreak of coronavirus in Italy has risen by 812 in the last 24 hours; the Civil Protection Agency said on Monday (Mar 30); reversing two days of declines. Italy; the world's hardest hit country which accounts for more than a thi…

Title: BP will not cut jobs over next three months: CEO Looney
Content: Oil major BP PLC  will not cut jobs over the next three months; Chief Executive Officer Bernard Looney said; even as the company seeks to reduce spending following an oil price crash.

Title: Israel to use computer analysis to find likely coronavirus carriers
Content: TEL AVIV: Israel's defence ministry plans to use software that analyses data gathered from mobile phones - produced; according to Israeli media; by the spyware firm NSO - to help locate likely carriers of the coronavirus in order to test them. Defence Ministe…

Title: Coronavirus hits hundreds of US police amid protective gear shortages
Content: NEW YORK: When nine police officers showed up to make an arrest near Melrose Avenue in the Bronx last Wednesday; none wore a mask or gloves to protect them from coronavirus.

Title: JPMorgan plans to raise up to US$10 billion for alternative investments: Bloomberg News
Content: JPMorgan Chase & Co's  alternative investments unit is seeking to raise up to US$10 billion to boost its spending power in the face of the coronavirus pandemic; Bloomberg News reported on Monday.

Title: Kohl's extends store closure; draws down US$1 billion credit facility amid coronavirus outbreak
Content: Kohl's Corp  said on Monday it would extend the duration of store closure; and fully draw down on its US$1 billion revolving credit facility to control damages from the coronavirus pandemic.

Title: France sees worst daily death toll as army ferries critical coronavirus patients

Title: US markets watchdog Clayton says SEC should not ban short-selling of shares
Content: The head of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Monday that it should not ban short-selling of shares; amid speculation on further measures the agency might take to arrest a market rout that stems from fears the coronavirus will spark a global…

Title: AmEx to freeze hiring; not cut jobs as coronavirus crisis deepens- Bloomberg News
Content: Credit card issuer American Express Co  will freeze hiring and avoid job cuts this year in response to the coronavirus pandemic; Bloomberg news reported on Monday; citing a video message to employees from Chief Executive Officer Steve Squeri.

Title: Japan destroyer; China fishing boat collide in sea off Shanghai
Content: TOKYO: A Japanese naval destroyer and a Chinese fishing boat have collided in the sea off Shanghai but there were no injuries; Japanese media reported early on Tuesday (Mar 31).

Title: Bostic: Fed programs could be broadened if they have missed important parts of economy
Content: As U.S. officials role out trillions of dollars in new economic support; a Federal Reserve policymaker on Monday said focus will now shift to whether those programs prove adequate or need to be expanded even further.

Title: Coronavirus drives US March auto sales off a cliff
Content: U.S. new vehicle sales likely drove off a cliff in March as the coronavirus pandemic pounded consumer confidence and shuttered dealerships across much of the country; and sales are likely to take a further beating in April as social distancing guidelines rema…

Title: Williams-Sonoma; Pottery Barn unit made unsubstantiated 'made in America' claims: FTC
Content: Luxury kitchenware company Williams-Sonoma Inc  and its Pottery Barn unit have agreed to stop making unsubstantiated "made in America" claims and to pay US$1 million; the Federal Trade Commission said on Monday.

Title: Disney Chairman Bob Iger to forgo salary amid virus crisis
Content: Walt Disney Inc  Executive Chairman Bob Iger will forgo his salary and newly named Chief Executive Officer Bob Chapek will take a 50per cent pay cut amid the coronavirus crisis; CNBC reported on Monday; citing an internal email.

Title: Instacart workers strike as labor unrest grows during coronavirus crisis
Content: NEW YORK: Some of the roughly 200;000 workers at U.S. online grocery delivery company Instacart said they were striking on Monday as labor unrest grows globally over safety and wages for people working through the coronavirus crisis. Workers at an Amazon.com …

Title: Macy's to furlough nearly 130;000 employees as virus keeps stores shut
Content: Macy's Inc  said on Monday it would furlough most of its employees starting this week as all stores of the department chain operator stay closed to curb the spread of the coronavirus.
